item.title: We Reap What We Sow
item.itunes:title: We Reap What We Sow
item.itunes:author: Dan Doolittle
item.itunes:subtitle: Guthrie Assembly Meeting 12/22/2023
item.itunes:summary: Bro. Dan Doolittle delivers a sermon reflecting on lessons from King Solomon's life. It analyzes how even the wisest person failed to tend his 'vineyard' by neglecting humility and kindness over time, leading to conflict and division. Despite wisdom to counsel others, Solomon did not heed warnings and planted seeds of arrogance reaped in bitterness. Core themes cover the universal laws of sowing and reaping, need for self-reflection, seeking God's wisdom, and living with love and humility daily to bear good fruit.

item.title: God Has An Answer
item.itunes:title: God Has An Answer
item.itunes:author: Ivan Eck
item.itunes:subtitle: Guthrie Assembly Meeting 12/23/2023
item.itunes:summary: Bro. Ivan Eck delivers a sermon focusing on themes of spiritual hunger, the importance of godly association, leaving worldly things behind to follow Christ, spending intentional time with God, and being fishers of men. Key points include how Christ's words can satisfy spiritual longings, the need to influence younger generations, Peter's miraculous catch of fish and subsequent commitment to discipleship, and exhortations to commune with God as the early Christians did.

item.title: A Light Load
item.itunes:title: A Light Load
item.itunes:author: Tony Sanchez
item.itunes:subtitle: Guthrie Assembly Meeting 12/23/2023
item.itunes:summary: Bro. Tony Sanchez delivers a sermon focused on the theme of bearing burdens, with stories and examples illustrating how Jesus can free people from heavy burdens of sin, guilt, worry and difficult life situations. Key points include contrasting worldly burdens versus Jesus' 'easy yoke', the importance of laying aside unnecessary weights slowing our spiritual race, carrying lost souls to Christ, and helping bear others' burdens through prayer and service.

item.title: Influence
item.itunes:title: Influence
item.itunes:author: Joseph Gellenbeck
item.itunes:subtitle: Guthrie Assembly Meeting 12/23/2023
item.itunes:summary: Bro. Joseph Gellenbeck reflects on the life of King Joash from 2 Chronicles 24. He examines how Joash initially followed God under the influence of the priest Jehoiada, but later turned away after Jehoiada died. He explores the importance of having personal convictions versus merely adopting those of mentors or the surrounding culture. Bro. Joseph challenges listeners to consider why they serve God and how they will pass faith onto the next generation.

item.title: First Love
item.itunes:title: First Love
item.itunes:author: Clinton Doolittle
item.itunes:subtitle: Guthrie Assembly Meeting 12/24/2023
item.itunes:summary: Bro. Clinton Doolittle delivers a sermon analyzing the issue of losing one's first love for God over time. It examines how the Ephesian church left their initial fervent devotion, and calls believers today to remember, repent and regain their passionate love for Christ. Action items involve evaluating current love for God, remembering past spiritual experiences, taking ownership to rekindle love, and doing initial works.

item.title: Lord Teach Us to Pray
item.itunes:title: Lord Teach Us to Pray
item.itunes:author: Marvin Moles
item.itunes:subtitle: Guthrie Assembly Meeting 12/24/2023
item.itunes:summary: Bro. Marvin Moles delivers a sermon focused on the importance of prayer, analyzing Biblical examples and key principles like humility, persistence and connecting intimately with God. Action items include praying for increased boldness in sharing one's faith, willingness to serve as a 'laborer' spreading the gospel message, and analyzing academic articles to understand target audience values and doubts.

item.title: The Plan of Healing and Restoration
item.itunes:title: The Plan of Healing and Restoration
item.itunes:author: Curtis Williams
item.itunes:subtitle: Guthrie Assembly Meeting 12/24/2023
item.itunes:summary: Bro. Curtis Williams reflects on God's wisdom and love in formulating a plan for healing, restoration and transformation to deal with the potential hurts, offenses and destruction that mankind faces. He emphasizes how God recognized from the very beginning of creation the need to provide hope and redemption to restore what is lost or damaged, whether physically in nature or spiritually in human lives. Key themes include appreciating God's foresight and intentional design, how God never intended for permanent ruin but always had restoration in mind, and that this gives confidence there is always hope in Christ.

item.title: A More Sure Word of Prophecy
item.itunes:title: A More Sure Word of Prophecy
item.itunes:author: Michael Smith
item.itunes:subtitle: Guthrie Assembly Meeting 12/25/2023
item.itunes:summary: Bro. Michael Smith analyzes Bible passages in 2 Peter about the reliability of Scripture and prophecy, emphasizing we can trust in Christ because of confirmed predictions rather than following human fables. Key themes include Peter and the apostles as eyewitnesses of Jesus' majesty and resurrection, many specific prophecies fulfilled in Jesus' life, the statistical impossibility of chance fulfillment, light of prophecy illuminating future events, and prophecy assuring believers of Christ's eventual return.

item.title: Reproof and Correction
item.itunes:title: Reproof and Correction
item.itunes:author: Bob Wilson
item.itunes:subtitle: Guthrie Assembly Meeting 12/25/2023
item.itunes:summary: Bro. Bob Wilson delivers a sermon reflecting on the importance of being open to reproof and correction in one's spiritual life. It analyzes several biblical passages indicating correction should be received as a kindness, not despised. Key themes include actively praying to see one's own faults, accepting responsibility for issues rather than blaming others, understanding godly reproof comes through love, and having humility to grow from righteous correction.

item.title: Working Together
item.itunes:title: Working Together
item.itunes:author: Marty Clevenger
item.itunes:subtitle: Guthrie Assembly Meeting 12/26/2023
item.itunes:summary: Bro. Marty Clevenger focuses on the importance of developing a personal relationship with God rather than just being part of a religious group. He analyzes biblical stories including David and Goliath to argue group identity cannot replace individual faith, prayer, spiritual gifts, and hearing God's voice. Numerous action items are suggested such as praying for oneself rather than expecting pastors to have all answers, using one's talents even if others could do it, and seeking a direct connection with God beyond just attending church.

item.title: What Do You Believe?
item.itunes:title: What Do You Believe?
item.itunes:author: Emmanuel Gracey
item.itunes:subtitle: Guthrie Assembly Meeting 12/26/2023
item.itunes:summary: Bro. Emmanuel Gracey examines foundational questions of personal belief systems and Biblical teachings on the origin of the universe, gender roles, salvation through Christ, life after death, and the end times. Key themes include upholding faith in God's Word, guarding against deception, embracing Christ as Savior, finding identity and purpose in creation, preparing for judgment, and persevering through trials.

item.title: The Reality of Life
item.itunes:title: The Reality of Life
item.itunes:author: Danny Adams
item.itunes:subtitle: Guthrie Assembly Meeting 12/26/2023
item.itunes:summary: Bro. Danny Adams reflects on the reality of life, struggles to stay spiritually grounded amid prosperity of the wicked, and the importance of choosing the right path guided by godly counsel. Key points include slippery slopes when envying success of ungodly, finding stability in god's presence, painting an accurate picture for the next generation, seeking wisdom from experienced Christians, and keeping perspective on what matters.

item.title: Hope for the Dry Bones
item.itunes:title: Hope for the Dry Bones
item.itunes:author: Ivan Eck
item.itunes:subtitle: Guthrie Assembly Meeting 12/27/2023
item.itunes:summary: Bro. Ivan Eck delivers a sermon reflecting on a passage from Ezekiel about dry bones coming back to life. It emphasizes that even when people feel spiritually dry or hopeless, God can revive and restore them to have purpose in serving Him. Key points include avoiding dry places through communion with God, prophesying hope to the hopeless, humility enabling strength, and maturing from spiritual babes to warriors in God's army.

item.itunes:title: The Ministry of Songs
item.itunes:author: Doris Clay
item.itunes:subtitle: Guthrie Assembly Meeting 12/27/2023
item.itunes:summary: Sis. Doris Clay examines the power and purpose of spiritual songs. Key points include using songs to worship and praise God, receive courage amidst trials, obey God's word, reflect our experiences, and avoid worldly music lacking spiritual meaning. She analyzes specific hymns and passages showing how singing helps connect believers to God's presence and grace.

item.title: Under a Cloud
item.itunes:title: Under a Cloud
item.itunes:author: Michael Smith
item.itunes:subtitle: Guthrie Assembly Meeting 12/27/2023
item.itunes:summary: Bro. Michael Smith delivers a sermon focused on living under clouds of guilt, shame and blame, analyzing a biblical story of Jesus forgiving an adulterous woman. It explores impacts of suppressing versus confessing sins, restoring broken relationships and overcoming past failures through Christ's love and grace. Action items center on examining personal areas of bondage, improving marriage communications, releasing others' faults, and embracing identity in God's forgiveness.

item.title: Faith
item.itunes:title: Faith
item.itunes:author: Marty Clevenger
item.itunes:subtitle: Guthrie Assembly Meeting 12/28/2023
item.itunes:summary: Bro. Marty Clevenger explores the concept of faith, emphasizing having faith in God rather than one's own mind or circumstances. He discusses misconceptions where faith is used as a catalyst for accomplishing personal will versus aligning with God's will. Examples are provided of biblical figures and the speaker's personal experiences. Takeaways include letting go of assumptions to understand God's omniscience, finding inspiration versus dictating outcomes, embracing difficulties as part of God's plan, and increased faith emerging from trials.

item.title: Procrastination
item.itunes:title: Procrastination
item.itunes:author: Josheph Gellenbeck
item.itunes:subtitle: Guthrie Assembly Meeting 12/28/2023
item.itunes:summary: Bro. Joseph Gellenbeck warns of the danger of procrastination, especially in spiritual matters. He explores reasons people procrastinate like comfort or busyness, consequences like missing opportunities, the need for self-discipline with God's help to overcome, and urges acting promptly when convicted.

item.title: Death and Resurrection
item.itunes:title: Death and Resurrection
item.itunes:author: Danny Adams
item.itunes:subtitle: Guthrie Assembly Meeting 12/29/2023
item.itunes:summary: Bro. Danny Adams deliver a sermon analyzing biblical passages on the first death, first resurrection, second death and second resurrection. It argues these refer to spiritual realms, with the first death being the loss of fellowship with God after the Garden of Eden. The first resurrection represents salvation restoring that relationship. The second death refers to final judgement when sin and death cease to exist. Partaking in the first resurrection allows escaping the second death. Action items involve seeking the first resurrection experience of salvation, discerning spiritual versus literal interpretations, and living above sin through God's power.

item.title: Fight the Good Fight of Faith
item.itunes:title: Fight the Good Fight of Faith
item.itunes:author: Bob Wilson
item.itunes:subtitle: Guthrie Assembly Meeting 12/29/2023
item.itunes:summary: Bro. Bob Wilson focuses on the importance of fighting against doubts and spiritual attacks from the devil to maintain faith and salvation. Key themes include how Satan tempts believers like he did Jesus, the need to resist his lies and accusations, learning to fight the good fight of faith through God's help, avoiding spiritual emptiness that allows demonic oppression, and laying hold of eternal life by overcoming sin.

item.title: Unto You
item.itunes:title: Unto You
item.itunes:author: churchofgodpreaching.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Guthrie Assembly Meeting 12/30/2023
item.itunes:summary:
Bro. Marty Clevenger delivers a sermon reflecting on the meaning of Christmas and the gift of salvation through Christ. Bro. Marty explores differing perspectives from outright rejection to wholehearted embrace of Christmas traditions. He emphasizes moving beyond debates over dates, origins or even outward observances to focus on accepting Christ’s gift of redemption, forgiveness and healing for ourselves. Through illustrations of a wild raccoon, tangled buck deer antlers, broken cisterns in a thirsty land, and the crucifixion scene, the message highlights parallels like fighting the gift or laboring to save ourselves versus simply receiving God’s grace.
Scriptures referenced: Philippians 1, Luke 2, John 3, Jeremiah
